NvTK.Explainer package¶

Submodules¶

NvTK.Explainer.Featuremap module¶

Feature map based model interpretation methods in NvTK.

NvTK.Explainer.Featuremap.get_activate_W(model, hook_module, data, pool=1, threshold=0.99, motif_width=20)[source]¶

Get activated motif pwm of input data at model.hook_module

model :
model
hook_module : int
hook_module
data_loader : torch.Data.Dataloader
input data
device : torch.device, optional
torch.device, Default is torch.device(“cuda”).
pool : int
input data
threshold : floor
threshold determine the activated sites in feature map
motif_width : int
width of motif, the width region sequence of activated sites will be normalized as counts
W : np.ndarr
array of activated motif pwm, shape of W (n_filters, 4, motif_width)

NvTK.Explainer.Featuremap.get_activate_sequence_from_fmap(fmap, X, pool=1, threshold=0.99, motif_width=40)[source]¶

Get activated sequence from feature map. Seqlets could be further analyzed by bioinformatic softwares, such as Homer2.

fmap : np.ndarr
feature map of input data at model.hook_module
X : np.ndarr
input data
pool : int
input data
threshold : floor
threshold determine the activated sites in feature map
motif_width : int
width of motif, the width region sequence of activated sites will be normalized as counts
W : list
list of activated motif seqlets, shape of W (n_filters, 4, motif_width)
M : list
Seqlet Names, defined as “Motif_Act”
NvTK.Explainer.Featuremap.save_activate_seqlets(model, hook_module, data, out_fname, pool=1, threshold=0.99, motif_width=40)[source]¶

Save activated Seqlets pwm from feature map Seqlets could be further analyzed by bioinformatic softwares, such as Homer2.

input data

NvTK.Explainer.Influence module¶

Influence based model interpretation methods in NvTK.

Influence quantified the Feed Forward Modification/Nullification of input, which measured the influence on each single task.

NvTK.Explainer.Influence.foldchange(origin, modified)[source]¶

caculate the fold change between modified and origin outputs.

NvTK.Explainer.Influence.correlation_ratio(categories, measurements)[source]¶

Correlation Ration (ETA) between categories and measurements.

NvTK.Explainer.Influence.channel_target_influence(model, hook_module, data_loader, device=device(type='cuda'))[source]¶

NvTK.Explainer.Motif module¶

Motif analysis in NvTK.

Currently, this module only support DNA MOTIF analysis.

NvTK.Explainer.Motif.calc_frequency_W(W, background=0.25)[source]¶

Calculate motif Frequency in pwms

NvTK.Explainer.Motif.calc_motif_IC(motif, background=0.25)[source]¶

Motif IC Bernouli

NvTK.Explainer.Motif.calc_motif_entropy(motif, background=0.25)[source]¶

Motif Entropy

NvTK.Explainer.Motif.calc_motif_frequency(motif_IC)[source]¶

Motif Frequency

NvTK.Explainer.Motif.info_content(pwm, bg=0.5)[source]¶

Motif IC Bernouli

NvTK.Explainer.Motif.meme_generate(W, output_file='meme.txt', prefix='Motif_')[source]¶

Generate meme file for pwms

NvTK.Explainer.Motif.normalize_pwm(pwm, factor=None, max=None)[source]¶

Normalize pwm

NvTK.Explainer.Motif.trim_ic(motif, cutoff=0.4, background=0.25)[source]¶

Trim motif based on IC(Bernouli)

NvTK.Explainer.MotifVisualize module¶

Motif Visualization in NvTK.

Currently, this module only support DNA MOTIF Visualization.

Protein Sequence Motif Visualization was under development.

NvTK.Explainer.MotifVisualize.filter_heatmap(pwm, output_fname=None, save=False, fig_size=(10, 7), norm=True, cmap='hot_r', cbar_norm=True)[source]¶

visualize pwm represented Filter in heatmap.

NvTK.Explainer.MotifVisualize.plot_filter_heatmap(W, factor=5, fig_size=(10, 7), save=True)[source]¶

visualize pwm represented Filter in heatmap.

NvTK.Explainer.MotifVisualize.plot_filter_logos(W, figsize=(10, 7), height=25, nt_width=10, norm=0, alphabet='dna', norm_factor=3, num_rows=None)[source]¶

visualize pwm represented filter Logo.

NvTK.Explainer.MotifVisualize.seq_logo(pwm, height=30, nt_width=10, norm=0, alphabet='dna', colormap='standard')[source]¶

generate sequence logo from pwm.

NvTK.Explainer.MotifVisualize.plot_seq_logo(logo, nt_width=None, step_multiple=None)[source]¶

visualize sequence logo.
